data.title: Rename cat.exe to something else
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 7 x64

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install Git for Windows
2. Install VS Code (or let it install a new version of itself).
3. The command `where cat` gives us:
```
c:\>where cat
C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders\bin\cat.exe
C:\Program Files (x86)\Git\usr\bin\cat.exe
```
4. This breaks scripts that expect that the command `cat` works like [the standard Unix utility](https://archive.org/details/msdos_Alley_Cat_1984).

data.title: Mac OS: Support file info popup when clicking on file in title
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.2 and OS X 10.1

There are several behaviors related 
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a file in VS Code
2. Rename that file in Finder
3. Note that VS Code now closes that tab instead of pointing the tab to the file with the new name
4. Also try single left-clicking on the window title where the filename is located, this does not pop up a file info dialog like in other apps

## For Step 3:
Other apps detect and follow the renaming of a file in Finder, and the opened document now point to the new file path.

## For Step 4:
Most document-based apps on OS X support this, and this allows easy renaming and tagging.

I was also going to write about the default keybinding for switching tabs not corresponding to the platform standard, but setting Cmd-Shift-[ and Cmd-Shift-] as the prev or next tab wasn't too hard in the end. Still wish it was by default though since platform defaults supersedes product defaults.

data.title: Avoid this.xy.bind(this) patterns in code
data.body:
I noticed quite some patterns of running event listeners like this: `this._themeService.onDidColorThemeChange(this._updateTheme.bind(this))`

This is very bad because the returned thing will be `any` and so you loose typing.

You will get an error here for example:

`lifecycleService.onBeforeUnload(this.onBeforeUnloadWindow.bind(this));`

=>

`lifecycleService.onBeforeUnload(window => this.onBeforeUnloadWindow(window));`

```
file: 'file:///Users/bpasero/Development/monaco/src/vs/platform/backup/electron-main/backupMainService.ts'
severity: 'Error'
message: 'Argument of type 'IVSCodeWindow' is not assignable to parameter of type 'VSCodeWindow'.
  Property 'options' is missing in type 'IVSCodeWindow'.'
at: '32,71'
source: 'ts'
```

data.title: Backup service: provide a list of available backups for a workspace
data.body:
This is a requirement to properly restore backups after a crash (https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/12327): Upon restart we automatically open folders that contain backups, however we miss information about the files that have backups.

The backup service should provide a method to get all untitled and file backups for a workspace so that we can reopen them. To minimize disk access and chances of staleness, I suggest to include the path within the backup file itself. E.g. the first N-bytes (up to a specific delimiter that is not allowed in file paths) can be the path and the rest is the file content. I would NOT use JSON for this and also NOT store this separately to avoid staleness issues.

data.title: Hot Exit gets hotter
data.body:
* Investigate to restore untitled dirty files via editor input factories (https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/15498)
* Hot Exit: Untitled files with no content should be restored (https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/14690)
* Untitled files are not restored to their previous groups (https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/14116)
* Fix dirty tab indicator after hot exit restore (https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/14038)

data.title: Fix Japanese transration "noExt"
data.body:

If "no file extension" is expressed in Japanese, it will be "".

|---|---|---|
|jshint|dbaeumer|0.10.15|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.0.8|
|vscode-instant-markdown|dbankier|0.1.0|
|Angular1|johnpapa|0.1.15|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.3.0|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|0.5.2|

---
CMD + and CMD - (on MacOS) are used in many applications to zoom in and out from the window.
In VSCode, however CMD+ actually zooms out (i.e. the opposite what other apps, such as MSPowerpoint, iTerm or Chrome does).

data.title: Highlight unused symbols

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I'd like to request an improvement to Typescript support: highlighting of unused symbols.

Refactoring and moving things around between files often leads to a lot of manual analysis, for example to find imports that are no longer in use.

This doesn't need to be a big, complex feature - I don't expect this to trawl through the entire codebase and figure out what is or isn't in use.

I'd be happy with just file-local highlighting - e.g. gray out variable and constant declarations if they aren't exported or used in any expression or statement anywhere in the file.

data.title: electron 1.4.7
Breakpoints are gone
data.body: I can no longer create a breakpoint.

data.title: Bad line number margin in diff editor
data.body:
The line number gutter seems to have been squeezed out of any padding it had. IMO the line number gutter shouldn't look any different than from a regular editor.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/20423704/2f1a8b3c-ad72-11e6-991e-96c9829b98a5.png)

data.title: Can't select line via the line numbers any more
data.body:
It used to be possible to select a whole line by clicking (and dragging) the line numbers. Now this seems not to be possible anymore. Additionally I seem to be able to _browser_ select the line numbers:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/20423666/feee9f98-ad71-11e6-8f90-2d0212fa98a0.png)

data.title: Diff - and + should be behind a setting
data.body:
The `-` and `+` now in the diff view take away horizontal space, forcing the line number gutter to be squeezed. This IMO was a bad compromise.

But in any case, give me a setting to not show the `-` and `+`.

data.body:

1. We begin and complete typing a word.
2. Autocomplete tells it exactly the same words, that it is not longer than the entered word.

data.title: DND: visible watermark prevents dropping of files
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. drag a file into the empty editor space over the watermark 
2. you are not getting the typical feedback to drop the file
3. it works fine outside of the watermark

Looks like the watermark div is preventing the DND handlers in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/browser/parts/editor/sideBySideEditorControl.ts#L917 to fire.

![editors](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/20420700/c01ea73e-ad5f-11e6-8d24-eff117a26416.gif)

data.title: DND: dropping a folder not possible after dragging a file in and out
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. I am seeing this on Mac, might be on all platforms 
2. start to drag a file from outside Code into Code (empty editor area) and then out again without dropping
3. start to drag a folder from outside into Code and notice you are not getting the drop feedback for opening a folder

=> somehow the listeners in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/electron-browser/window.ts#L111 are not triggered and thus there is no clean up happening.

data.title: Support for Angular 2 special selectors in CSS
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a new SCSS or CSS file
2. Attempt to add a selector that uses [Angular 2's special selectors](https://angular.io/docs/ts/latest/guide/component-styles.html#!#special-selectors)
3. Observe that VS Code considers this syntax an error.

An example selector would be: 
```
/deep/ .my-class {
  width: 0.75em;
  height: 0.75em;
}
```

Not only does it consider the `/deep/` to be an error, but it also gets really confused and marks other errors on the colon of `height: 0.75em;` and the closing brace.
